resources.string: " “Danetkas” is for a minimum of 2 players. One is the Master(who knows the answers) and the rest are Investigators. The Investigators ask questions in the form of “Yes”/”No”. The Master replies according to the answer. The riddle is solved when one of the Investigators can explain everything on the hint card."

" The Investigators can check the riddle during the whole gameplay. The Master can also check the riddle, but the \nInvestigators CANNOT see the answer. After all the players examine the received information "
" The Investigators ask “Yes”/”No” questions. The Master can answer using the following options:"

“A composer named 
Remi survived a 
gunshot but later 
died of cancer.”
Did he die right after\n receiving a gunshot?
Did he end up dying\n of an illness?
Look carefully at all the information that you can find, everything might have a double meaning, every little detail is important (or maybe not).

" It’s up to you to decide how strict you want to be. The Master can help by using intonations and giving directions. If you see that the Investigators still can’t find the solution, ask them to look again at the information provided, check if they miss anything. If the Investigators run out of questions, then the players can ask for extra hints their wise friend Mr. Rigoletto. "

" It's up to the Master to decide which extra hint to give depending on which part of the story the Investigators have difficulty solving. It’s up to you to decide how detailed you want to get the story. If you are a perfectionist you should find out everything. No need to get the story word by word but you need to explain everything, including the picture and the title. If something does not make sense to the Investigators, dig deeper. "
There can be different “logical” storylines you might come up with, but the ONLY correct answer is the one provided in the app. The Master MUST answer the questions according to that.

Most of the stories present in this game are true historical events or debatable by musicologists. If you see this icon, that means that we, the creators of this game, made up the story based on real musical and historical facts.
Do not ask the help of Mr. Rigoletto.
Invent your own Rigolettos instead of using the ones provided.

Avoid false assumptions and make a lot of questions, going step by step, instead of coming up with a story. “The woman was a street musician and then someone gave her money and she bought an instrument with that?”
 That can be broken down into
 several questions:
 “Was the woman a musician?”
 “Did someone give her money?”
 “Did she want to buy an instrument?” 
Etc...
